slang.title: Rio Slang

hero.title: Welcome to the Rio Slang Guide
hero.subtitle: Learn how locals really speak

slang.introduction: Slang is an informal and creative form of language used in everyday life. Cariocas (people from Rio) love using unique expressions that reflect the city's vibrant and laid-back culture. Knowing these slangs will help you better understand conversations, connect with locals, and make the most of your experience in the city!

items.explanation: Very casual greeting used among friends
Means everything is fine or to agree with something
items.exampleTranslation: Shall we go to the beach? Alright!

items.explanation: Casual way to say thank you
Asks if the person understood or is aware of something
items.example: O show é às 8, tá ligado?
items.exampleTranslation: The show is at 8, you know?

items.explanation: Means something impressive or very good

items.example: Não ir à festa foi um vacilo.
items.exampleTranslation: Not going to the party was a mistake.

items.explanation: Interjection to express disappointment or surprise
items.example: Pô, cara, por que você não veio?
items.exampleTranslation: Come on, man, why didn't you come?

items.explanation: Casual way to refer to a man or woman

items.example: Esse é meu parça de infância.

items.explanation: Can be affectionate or literal, depending on context
Respectful or affectionate term for someone
Something is happening or in progress
items.example: Tá rolando uma festa na praia hoje.
items.exampleTranslation: There's a party happening at the beach today.

items.explanation: Solve a problem in an improvised way
Being inattentive or making it easier for something bad to happen
items.example: Não dá mole na rua à noite.
items.exampleTranslation: Don't let your guard down on the street at night.

rioWords.explanation: Name given to those born or living in Rio de Janeiro
Important geographical divisions of the city

emergency.example: Por favor, onde fica o hospital mais próximo?
emergency.exampleTranslation: Please, where is the nearest hospital?

emergency.translation: I need to call the police
emergency.example: Preciso chamar a polícia, onde posso ligar?
emergency.exampleTranslation: I need to call the police, where can I call?

emergency.example: Alguém me roubou, preciso fazer um boletim.
emergency.exampleTranslation: Someone robbed me, I need to file a report.

culturalTips.title: Cultural Tips
tips: Cariocas are very informal and friendly - don't be offended by quick intimacy
The 'r' at the end of words is usually not pronounced strongly
Always use 'por favor' and 'obrigado/a' - politeness is valued
Slang changes fast - don't be afraid to ask the meaning
In formal situations, avoid using too much slang
